title: How to Make a Cookie Wreath

steps.headline: Make the cookies, pierce two holes at the top of each cookie.
steps.description: The reason for two holes is to keep the cookie straight when it's on the wreath. A toothpick, a skewer or a similar tool is ideal for making the cookie holes. The holes need to be large enough to thread through your chosen threading item.

steps.headline: Bake as recommended by the recipe.
Remove the baked cookies from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool before making the cookie wreath.

steps.headline: Arrange the cookie pattern you want to make into a wreath.
steps.description:
The pattern can be single cookie types or a variety of cookies in a recurring theme. Some ideas include:
A circle of gingerbread men
A circle of stars
A circle of one gingerbread man, one star, one circle, repeat all the way around, etc.

steps.headline: Thread the ribbon or other chosen thread through the holes of the cookies.
steps.description: When threading, push the ribbon through the back of the first hole, across the front of the cookie, and back down through to the back via the second hole. Turn the the next cookies.

steps.headline: Thread on as many as it takes to create a circle.
Tie off the ribbon or other thread material with a knot.
Hang on a tree, a door or other part of your house.

text:
Assemble the items needed. These are listed below. Make the cookies, pierce two holes at the top of each cookie. The reason for two holes is to keep the cookie straight when it's on the wreath. A toothpick, a skewer or a similar tool is ideal for making the cookie holes. The holes need to be large enough to thread through your chosen threading item. Bake as recommended by the recipe.  Remove the baked cookies from the oven. Allow to cool before making the cookie wreath. Arrange the cookie pattern you want to make into a wreath. The pattern can be single cookie types or a variety of cookies in a recurring theme. Some ideas include:
A circle of gingerbread men
A circle of stars
A circle of one gingerbread man, one star, one circle, repeat all the way around, etc. Thread the ribbon or other chosen thread through the holes of the cookies. When threading, push the ribbon through the back of the first hole, across the front of the cookie, and back down through to the back via the second hole. Turn the the next cookies. Thread on as many as it takes to create a circle.  Tie off the ribbon or other thread material with a knot.  Hang on a tree, a door or other part of your house.
